<|bos|><|user|>
Install and configure MySQL
<|/user|><|assistant|>
I'll help you set up MySQL:

<|exec|>
$ sudo apt install -y mysql-server
<|/exec|>
<|exec_result|>
Setting up mysql...
<|/exec_result|>
<|exec|>
$ sudo systemctl start mysql
<|/exec|>
<|exec_result|>
(no output)
<|/exec_result|>
<|exec|>
$ sudo mysql -e "CREATE DATABASE inactive_request;"
<|/exec|>
<|exec_result|>
(no output)
<|/exec_result|>
<|exec|>
$ sudo mysql -e "CREATE USER 'victor'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'password123';"
<|/exec|>
<|exec_result|>
(no output)
<|/exec_result|>
<|exec|>
$ mysql --version
<|/exec|>
<|exec_result|>
mysql  Ver 8.30 for Linux on x86_64
<|/exec_result|>

Done! MySQL is now installed and configured.
<|/assistant|><|eos|>

<|bos|><|user|>
Install and configure PostgreSQL
<|/user|><|assistant|>
I'll help you set up PostgreSQL:

<|exec|>
$ sudo apt install -y postgresql postgresql-contrib
<|/exec|>
<|exec_result|>
Setting up postgresql...
<|/exec_result|>
<|exec|>
$ sudo systemctl start postgresql
<|/exec|>
<|exec_result|>
(no output)
<|/exec_result|>
<|exec|>
$ sudo -u postgres createdb old_notification
<|/exec|>
<|exec_result|>
(no output)
<|/exec_result|>
<|exec|>
$ sudo -u postgres psql -c "CREATE USER alice WITH PASSWORD 'password123';"
<|/exec|>
<|exec_result|>
(no output)
<|/exec_result|>
<|exec|>
$ psql --version
<|/exec|>
<|exec_result|>
psql (PostgreSQL) 13.1
<|/exec_result|>

Done! PostgreSQL is now installed and configured.
<|/assistant|><|eos|>

<|bos|><|user|>
Install and configure MongoDB
<|/user|><|assistant|>
I'll help you set up MongoDB:

$ sudo apt install -y mongodb
<|/exec|>
<|exec_result|>
Setting up mongodb...
<|/exec_result|>

$ sudo systemctl start mongodb
<|/exec|>
<|exec_result|>
(no output)
<|/exec_result|>
<|exec|>
$ mongosh --eval 'use inactive_account'
<|/exec|>
<|exec_result|>
(no output)
<|/exec_result|>
<|exec|>
$ mongosh inactive_account --eval 'db.createUser({user: "jack", pwd: "password123", roles: ["readWrite"]})'
<|/exec|>
<|exec_result|>
(no output)
<|/exec_result|>
<|exec|>
$ mongosh --version
<|/exec|>
<|exec_result|>
1.5.8
<|/exec_result|>

Done! MongoDB is now installed and configured.
